intro: Chassalia bosseri, commonly known as the Bosser's chassalia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance. Chassalia bosseri is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
